text.headline: History of Hogenakkal
text.text: A timeline of significant events related to Hogenakkal Falls and the surrounding region.

text.headline: Sangam Period - Rule of King Adiyaman Neduman Anji
text.text: The area was known as Thalaineer Naadu and the falls as Thalaineer aruvi in Sangam literature (Purananooru, Agananooru). The original Tamil name is believed to be Uguneer Kal.

text.headline: Mysore Kingdom Rule - The Name 'Hogenakkal'
text.text: The name 'Hogenakkal' becomes prevalent. It is derived from the Kannada words 'hoge' (smoke) and 'kal' (rock), meaning 'Smoky Rocks'.

text.headline: Mettur Dam Constructed
text.text: The Mettur Dam, which forms the Stanley Reservoir, is built downstream from the falls.

text.headline: Crocodile Rehabilitation Center Established
text.text: A center for the rehabilitation of crocodiles is established near the falls.
